faqs.question: What is the typical size of a Marla measurement used for plots on Barnala Road Ambala
faqs.answer: In most parts of Ambala, including the Barnala Road area, one Marla is generally equivalent to 25 square yards. It is essential for buyers to confirm this measurement unit with the seller and verify the plot’s dimension records (lambi-chauri) stated in the registry documents to ensure accurate calculation of the total land area before finalizing the purchase agreement.

faqs.question: Are the plots on Barnala Road generally approved for residential construction by local authorities

faqs.question: What essential documents must I verify before buying a Plot For Sale in Barnala Road Ambala
faqs.answer: Key documents required for verification include the original title deed, mutation record (Jamabandi), non-encumbrance certificate (NEC), and the development authority’s approval plan for the layout. It is also crucial to check if all property taxes have been cleared up to date. Our advisory service assists in verifying all these legal requirements for your peace of mind.
